page.title: 04NEWNHAM POST OFFICE
page.content: THE POST OFFICE IS JUST A ROOM OF A HOUSE WITH A WOODEN COUNTER. THERE IS ONE STEP UP TO THE RED DOOR. THE FLOOR IS TILED. MRS JOYCE GRIFFITHS HAS LIVED THERE FOR 34 YEARS BUT THERE HAS BEEN A POST OFFICE THERE FOR 8O YEARS. THE POST OFFICE IS OPEN FROM 9AM TO 1.30PM EXCEPT FOR WEDNESDAY AND SATURDAY WHICH ARE HALF DAYS. THE POST VAN COMES FROM TENBURY THEN GOES TO NEWNHAM,FRITH COMMON AND EARDISTON. THE POSTMAN OPENS THE BOX AFTER 9.4OAM AND AT 4.40PM. THE POST DOES NOT GET COLLECTED ON SUNDAY,GOOD FRIDAY,BOXING DAY,CHRISTMAS DAY AND OTHER BANK HOLIDAYS.LETTERS ARE TAKEN TO TENBURY, WORCESTER THEN SWINDON.MRS GRIFFITHS HAS 2 DOGS,ONE IS A GUARD DOG.SHE SELLS ABOUT Â£45 WORTH OF STAMPS A WEEK AND 40 TO 50 PEOPLE COME TO COLLECT PENSIONS.
